area.description: Nelson District (ie. from Cape Soucis, through Nelson City to Stoke), also the Bryant Range

features.conditions: Expect 140 to 200 mm of rain to accumulate about the ranges, and 60 to 100 mm elsewhere.  Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h, with heaviest falls overnight.
features.impact: This rain is expected to cause dangerous river conditions and significant flooding. Slips and floodwaters are likely to disrupt travel, making some roads impassable and possibly isolating communities.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

features.changeNotes: Heavy rain warning has been extended to 3am Saturday.
features.conditions: Expect a further 30 to 40 mm of rain to accumulate on top of what has already fallen north of Hikurangi, and lesser amounts in the south. Peak rates of about 10 mm/h in the north.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

features.conditions: Expect a further 100 to 150 mm of rain to accumulate on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

area.description: The Tasman District west of Motueka

features.conditions: Expect 150 to 200 mm of rain to accumulate about the ranges, and 80 to 110 mm about low lying areas.  Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/hr Friday evening and overnight, especially about the ranges.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

area.description: The Marlborough Sounds, Rai Valley and the Richmond Range

features.conditions: Expect 140 to 180 mm of rain to accumulate about the ranges and northern parts of the Sounds, and 70 to 100 mm elsewhere.  Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

features.conditions: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain to accumulate about the ranges, and 40 to 80 mm near the coast. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/hr about the ranges.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

features.conditions: Expect 100 to 150 mm of rain to accumulate about the ranges, and 40 to 60 mm about the coast. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/hr about the ranges.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

area.description: The Tasman District from Motueka eastwards, excluding Nelson District

features.conditions: Periods of heavy rain. Rainfall amounts may approach warning criteria.
features.title: Heavy Rain Watch

area.description: Marlborough northwest of the Inland Kaikoura Range and south of the Richmond Range

features.conditions:
Periods of heavy rain. Rainfall amounts may approach warning criteria.

Note, lower accumulations are expected in the Wairau Valley, but there is still potential for flooding from heavy rain in the surrounding ranges.
features.title: Heavy Rain Watch

area.description: North Taranaki away from the Mountain

features.conditions: Further rain is expected overnight and on Saturday morning, but significant falls are not expected.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

features.conditions: Further rain is expected overnight and on Saturday morning, but significant falls are not expected.
features.impact: Heavy rain may cause streams and rivers to rise rapidly. Surface flooding and slips are also possible and driving conditions may be hazardous.
features.title: Heavy Rain Warning

situation.headline: Further heavy rain for northern and western parts of New Zealand overnight and Saturday morning
situation.statement:
A slow-moving complex trough of low pressure, preceded by a moist northerly flow, covers New Zealand. The trough is expected to move slowly eastwards across the country overnight and on Saturday morning. This weather system is forecast to bring further periods of northerly rain to northern and western parts of New Zealand, where numerous Heavy Rain Warnings and Watches are in place. 

A Red Heavy Rain Warning remains in force for Nelson. 

Note, this period of heavy rain could lead to more surface flooding and slips due to the ground already being saturated from recent heavy rain.

People are advised to keep up to date with the latest forecasts.
